marketNews.title: Rupiah Weakens Since Early June 2024, Approaches Level 16,300
marketNews.content: The Indonesian rupiah weakened against the US dollar intraday, breaching the 16,300 level on Thursday, 6 June 2024, marking the weakest level since April 2020, before closing slightly higher by +0.02% at 16,279. Since the start of June 2024, the rupiah has fallen 0.3% month‑to‑date as of Thursday (6/6). The depreciation occurred alongside a weakening of the US dollar index (DXY), which fell 0.6% month‑to‑date to the 104 level on Thursday (6/6). The rupiah’s weakness coincided with a narrowing of Indonesia’s trade‑surplus due to commodity price normalization, outflows of funds during the Hajj season, and dividend repatriation by foreign investors in Indonesian companies. Since early June, the Indonesian capital market recorded net foreign outflows, with net outflows of IDR 43 billion in the bond market on Tuesday (4/6) and IDR 53 billion in the equity market on Wednesday (5/6). The US labor market showed weakness: the US Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that April 2024 job openings fell to about 8.06 million (versus 8.36 million in March 2024), below the consensus of 8.36 million and the lowest since February 2021. ADP reported private‑sector payroll hiring in May 2024 at 152,000 (versus 188,000 in April 2024), also below the consensus of 175,000. In line with the soft US labor data, the market now expects the Federal Reserve to begin cutting rates in September 2024; the CME FedWatch Tool shows a 78.3% probability of a September rate cut on Thursday (6/6), up from 59.6% on Monday (3/6).

marketNews.title: Asian Emerging‑Market Stocks See Two‑Month Foreign Outflows in May 2024
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that emerging‑market equities in Asia experienced a second consecutive month of foreign outflows in May 2024, driven by strong US economic data that heightened skepticism about a Federal Reserve rate cut. The report noted that stock markets in India, Indonesia, Vietnam, Thailand, South Korea, the Philippines and Taiwan posted a combined net foreign outflow of US$3.58 billion in May 2024, following a US$4.92 billion outflow in April 2024. Indonesia’s equity market contributed a net foreign outflow of US$881 million. By contrast, Taiwan’s market recorded a net foreign inflow of US$2.41 billion in May 2024, reversing a US$4.61 billion outflow in April 2024, driven by AI‑related sentiment.

marketNews.title: Indonesia’s Coal Production Reaches 34.6% of 2024 Target
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources reported that national coal production as of 5 June 2024 reached 319 million tonnes, covering only 34.6% of the 2024 target of 922.14 million tonnes. Indonesian Mining Association Executive Director Hendra Sinadia said the 2024 coal output is expected to fall short of the target, noting that first‑quarter production was not optimal due to global oversupply conditions.

marketNews.title: Saudi Aramco Cuts Oil Prices for Asia in July 2024
marketNews.content: Saudi Aramco reduced its oil price for Asia for July 2024, marking the first cut since February 2024. The price of Arab Light crude was lowered by 50 cents to US$2.40 per barrel above the regional benchmark, versus a market expectation of a 40‑cent cut.

marketNews.title: Nvidia Overtakes Apple as World’s No. 2 Largest Company
marketNews.content: Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) officially overtook Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) as the world’s second‑largest company by market capitalisation on Wednesday, 5 June 2024. Nvidia’s market cap reached US$3.01 trillion, surpassing Apple’s US$3.00 trillion, though still below Microsoft’s US$3.15 trillion. Nvidia’s share price has risen 216.8% year‑over‑year, driven by strong demand for AI chips. The company also announced a 1‑for‑10 stock split effective 7 June 2024.

marketNews.title: President Joko Widodo Plans to Work from the New Capital City in July 2024
marketNews.content: Indonesian President Joko Widodo said on Wednesday, 5 June 2024 that he plans to start working from the new capital city (IKN) in July 2024. He noted that the first‑phase infrastructure of the new capital has reached about 80% completion. The statement came a few days after the government announced the resignations of IKN Authority Head Bambang Susantono and Deputy Head Dhony Rahajoe, without further explanation.

marketNews.title: Ecocare Indo Pacific (HYGN) Announces 2023 Dividend
marketNews.content: Ecocare Indo Pacific (ticker HYGN) will distribute a 2023 dividend of 5.45 billion rupiah, equivalent to 2.16 rupiah per share, representing a 30% dividend payout ratio. The dividend is payable on the regular market and negotiation sessions, with the ex‑dividend date not yet announced. Based on a closing price of 168 rupiah on Thursday (6/6), the implied dividend yield is approximately 1.3%.

tickerNews.title: IMAS Secures US$450 Million Syndicated Loan
tickerNews.content: Indomobil Sukses Internasional, through its subsidiary PT IMG Sejahtera Langgeng, secured a US$450 million syndicated loan led by Bank BTPN and Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation, with participation from 32 lenders. The facility includes several tranches, one of which is a green‑finance tranche of US$225.8 million intended to develop the electric‑vehicle ecosystem.

tickerNews.title: Petrosea Signs US$230 Million Mining Services Term‑Sheet with PT Global Bara Mandiri
tickerNews.content: Petrosea signed a term‑sheet for a mining services contract with PT Global Bara Mandiri, with an estimated contract value of US$230 million and a duration of eight years, extendable to a life‑of‑mine term.

tickerNews.title: CASS Tender Offer for 359 Million Shares at 883 Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Cardig Aero Services’ subsidiary PT Roket Cipta Sentosa launched a tender offer for 359 million shares (17.2% of CASS) from 5 June to 4 July 2024, pricing the offer at 883 rupiah per share, a 15.9% discount to the 1,050 rupiah closing price on Thursday (6/6). Investors participating in the offer will receive payment on 16 July 2024. Previously, PT Roket Cipta Sentosa acquired 1.06 billion shares (approximately 51%) of CASS for 872.8 billion rupiah in April 2024.

tickerNews.title: MIKA Declares 2023 Dividend of 34 Rupiah per Share
tickerNews.content: Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat announced a 2023 dividend of approximately 483 billion rupiah, or 34 rupiah per share. The dividend is payable on the regular and negotiation markets on 12 June 2024, with payment scheduled for 5 July 2024. Based on a closing price of 2,950 rupiah on Thursday (6/6), the implied dividend yield is about 1.2%.

tickerNews.title: TOTO Announces Final 2023 Dividend
tickerNews.content: Surya Toto Indonesia announced a final 2023 dividend of approximately 92.9 billion rupiah, or 9 rupiah per share. The dividend is payable on the regular and negotiation markets on 11 June 2024, with payment on 28 June 2024. Using a closing price of 208 rupiah on Thursday (6/6), the implied dividend yield is 4.3%. The company also paid an interim dividend of about 92.9 billion rupiah, or 9 rupiah per share, in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: FILM Commissioner Purchases 1.65 Million Shares at 4,200 Rupiah
tickerNews.content: MD Pictures commissioner Sanjeva Advani purchased 1.65 million shares of FILM at 4,200 rupiah per share on 30 May 2024, a transaction valued at roughly 6.9 billion rupiah. After the purchase, Advani’s ownership in FILM rose from 0% to 0.02%.

tickerNews.title: MAHA Director Yenny Hamidah Koean Buys 15.5 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Mandiri Herindo Adiperkasa’s President Director Yenny Hamidah Koean bought 15.5 million shares of MAHA at approximately 227.9 rupiah per share on 5 June 2024, a transaction worth about 3.5 billion rupiah. After the purchase, Yenny’s stake increased from 7.87% to 7.96%.
